Item.text: The first section of the chart states that we have to begin with identifying the text as persuasive. # This is done when you first read the text and decide if it is persuasive.
Ok! What's next?
Let's continue.
_user_ you helped Jordan so much!
_user_ you have! # I think we both learned a lot in today's lesson! # Cristina can you run through what we did today?
Of course Jordan! # Today we practised understanding persuasive texts! # In order to understand persuasive texts we must identify the topic, the main argument, and then any supporting information.
Remind me what supporting information is again?
Supporting information is the information a writer includes in their main argument to back up their argument.
Got it!
I hope you two remember these tips as you continue on with your future lessons.
Thanks Cristina! # I'm sure we will!
Have a great day you two! # Bye
_user_ and Cristina bye.
I hope you are enjoying the article. # Here is another question.

Item.text: Right! # Then, you locate supporting information within the article. # Supporting information helps back up the writer's argument.
So supporting information is anything that helps the writer make their argument!

Yes! # Jordan you are right! # Also in this type of writing many people try to manipulate your emotions. # The writer uses emotional techniques to get their point across. # Stronger support is backed up by facts and reasons rather than just emotions. # Emotional appeals without facts are often used in advertisements.
Okay. # So emotional appeals support persuasive texts that are advertisements. # However, other types of persuasive texts need to be backed up by facts and sensible reasons.
Yes! # You got it! # _user_ Here is the first article! # Please reed it and when you are finished click continue below.
Let's continue! # With the next question pay close attention to what the writer is trying to persuade us to think.
_user_ and Jordan let's take a look at another question!
Next you have to identify the topic of the article! # The topic of the article is the main issue under discussion in the article!
So we do this by reading the article and figuring out what the article is about? Great! What's next!
Item.speech: So we do this by reeding the article and figuring out what the article is about? # Great! # What's next!
